extendedInfo.description: Turn off vibrate !VibraFix forces the haptic feedback to stop.WARNING : ROOT RIGHTS REQUIRED. On some devices, when you uncheck the haptic feedback option in settings, vibrate stills enabled for some keys.This app is useful for people who are annoyed with this, in my point of view, bug.It's also allways a good idea to deactivate haptic feedback in order to save some power juice.How does it work ?VibraFix stops totaly the vibrate with a rude and simple method : changing the permission (777 to 444) for the vibrate ressource.Features :Vibrafix forces vibrate to stop.VibraFix can be started automaticaly at boot.VibraFix is a quiet application running in the background and uses very little resources.VibraFix can enable again the vibrate when a phone call or/and a SMS is received.There is also an attempt to deal with the vibrate when an AlarmClock is trigged.Optional notification in order to enable vibrate in one click.Optional shortcuts to enable or not Vibrafix (Switch ON, Switch OFF and Switcher) Devices concerned :This fix has been tested only on Motorola Defy (stock ROMs android 2.1 and android 2.2.1)but should certainly works also on other phone devices/ROMs with the same bug.According to stats, VibraFix is installed and used on :Motorola devices ~85% : Motorola Defy, Motorola Milestone2, Motorola Atrix, Motorola Droid I & IIbut also : Samsung Galaxy S2, Samsung Galaxy Mini, LG Swift, LG Optimus One, tcc8900, IVIO_DE38, HTC Nexus OneDonations :VibraFix is FREE to use - and without ads.However if you want to support this app, donations are welcome. Thanks.contact/support/donation : http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1103628If you vote negative without information about your problem or without contact me with support page... I will not be able to try to help you !

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: Ever since I first got this phone it annoyed me that turning off the haptic feedback did nothing. I googled a solution and your amazing app came up, thanks so much! It still amazes me this app needs to exist and it hasn\'t been sorted officially yet.

reviews.title: Savior for Droid2 and Droid2 Global users
reviews.comment: Despite all haptic feedback options disabled on Droid2 and Droid 2 Global, the soft keys (menu, home, back, search) still vibrate when pressed. Not any more thanks to Vibrafix!
